thread.title: ME says he was bullied by DA after changing homicide finding - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: ME says he was bullied by DA after changing homicide finding - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: ME says he was bullied by DA after changing homicide finding - Massachusetts news
text:
BOSTON (AP) — The medical examiner who reversed a homicide finding in the death of a 6-month-old baby writes in case notes that Middlesex District Attorney Marian Ryan and her office ‘‘bullied’’ him in an attempt to get him to stick with his original determination.
The Boston Globe (http://bit.ly/1LLgqXO ) reports that forensic pathologist Peter Cummings initially ruled that the 2010 death of Nathan Wilson was the result of violent shaking. The father, Geoffrey Wilson, was charged with murder.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Cummings later said the cause of death could not be determined after defense experts found a genetic defect that made members of the family prone to blood vessel ruptures. Charges were dropped.
Cummings wrote that the behavior of Ryan and her staff was ‘‘unethical and unprofessional.’’
Ryan denied Cummings assertions and said he was ‘‘puzzled’’ by them.
___
Information from: The Boston Globe, http://www.bostonglobe.com
